fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL3-2022-FCT-01-05: Effective fight against corruption
fields.title: MORALE (tentative)
fields.department_role: Ανάπτυξη μεθόδων σύντηξης πληροφορίας και τεχνικών εξήγησης των αποφάσεων που λαμβάνει το σύστημα
fields.abstract:
MORALE will build upon already identified best practices from different domains, providing a unifying framework coupled with emerging technologies that will assist LEAs to quickly identify and thus prevent corruption incidents. 


•	Strengthening cooperation among LEAs and anti-corruption agencies to address the scourge of corruption by creating inter-institutional groups and promoting the exchange of relevant information such as banking, tax, and stock market information, identification of final beneficiaries, and real estate and personal property registries.
•	Enhance international cooperation and asset recovery, as well as the identification of the beneficial owners of business vehicles that are misused in such corruption cases
•	Build capacity for LEAs and anti-corruption agencies especially in EU countries that suffer from chronic fragility, conflict and violence by identifying ways to leverage international resources to support and sustain good governance
•	Learn by doing: Any good strategy must be continually monitored and evaluated to make sure it can be easily adapted as situations on the ground change.

fields.thematic_areas:
Σχεδιασμός και υλοποίηση αλγορίθμων για ηλεκτρονική υγεία
Biobanks
fields.title: Multi-Pillar Framework for children Anti-Obesity Behavior building on an EU biobank, Micro Moments and Mobile Recommendation Systems
fields.department_staff: Koινό έργο με το τμήμα διαιτολογίας (υπό την κα Κοντογιάννη) με συνολικό προϋπολογισμό για το Πανεπιστήμιο 700.000.
fields.abstract:
During the last decades, overweight & obesity rates have reached epidemic proportions across EU. Prevalence in childhood is
particularly alarming, resulting in psychological impacts & increased risks for NCDs. However, although obesity-related research has
provided interesting results, several issues arise due to the lack of meta-reviews & the nature of data collected. To address this, BioStreams aims on supporting the optimal use (and re-use) of health data (e.g. biological, demographic, epigenetic, etc.) to generate
metadata/knowledge and provide new evidences, methodologies & tools for: a) creating and deploying the Bio-Streams Biobank that
will act as a scientific platform for research in obesity and better diagnostic and therapeutic approaches;b) understanding the
transition from metabolically healthy to unhealthy, preventing under age obesity; c) designing better strategies to educate &
empower young citizens for weight self-management; d) coordinating authorities & policy makers to develop cross-sectoral solutions
for health promotion & under age obesity prevention. Specifically, Bio-Streams delivers a dedicated under age obesity biobank
providing real-world health data (including biospecimens, anthropometrics, behavioural and cost data) from retrospective and
prospective sources, while taking into account efficient data harmonisation and standardisation principles, transforming data
valorisation towards under age obesity prevention and future research. Moreover, the Bio-Streams framework for data handling,
provides robust and transparent methodologies for operational procedures (data infrastructures), analysis and reporting (via metareviews and AI-based Apps/components, evaluated via 12 multi-site pilots (7 clinical and 5 schools)), citizen awareness and lifestyle
alteration, delivering obesity prevention guidelines, knowledge generation while fostering considerable opportunities for regional
and national health authorities/policymakers

fields.title: Optical and WIreless sensors Networks for 6G scenarios
fields.abstract:
In the Optical and WIreless sensors Networks for 6G scenarios (OWIN6G) project important industry and academic stakeholders are brought together with the goal of developing a structured European
training programme (TP) in optical technologies to facilitate disruptive wireless sensor applications within sixth-generation (6G) wireless networks. OWIN6G will be the first Training Network dedicated to the field of wireless sensor networks for Internet of Things/Internet of Everything as part of the 6G and beyond by focusing on novel sensors,
solar-cells for power and optical detection, and the hybrid RF-optical wireless technologies, as well as intruding machine learning for adoptability and optimization and security aspects in sensor networks. Through the collaborative research via ten individual ESRs projects focusing on selected challenges and applications, OWIN6G will make significant contributions to the fundamental scientific understanding, technical know-how and innovation on the future hybrid optical/RF sensor network. In addition to technical training through PhD courses, dedicated tutorials and workshops organized by the Doctoral Network, ESRs will benefit from a wide range of complementary non-technical training activities such as entrepreneurship, authoring scientific papers/patents, dissemination, etc. The participation of industrial partners will further promote research training on standardization and commercialisation aspects.

fields.call: HORIZON-HLTH-2023-DISEASE-03-01 - Novel approaches for palliative and end-of-life care for non-cancer patients
fields.thematic_areas: Τεχνητή νοημοσύνη και εφαρμογές της στην υγεία
fields.title: Advancing objective patient state and symptom assessment for improving the quality of life of advanced dementia patients receiving palliative care
fields.department_role: Ανάπτυξη μοντέλων τεχνητής νοημοσύνης για την αντικειμενική μέτρηση του πόνου και της σωματικής ή ψυχολογικής καταπόνησης μέσω πολλαπλών φορητών αισθητήρων (EEG, ECG, EDA, επιταχυνσιόμετρα, γυροσκόπια, PPG).
fields.abstract:
Dementia is affecting more and more people worldwide and is becoming a significant long-term medical challenge, mainly driven by population growth and ageing. Currently, there are more than 55 million people living with dementia worldwide, and there are nearly 10 million new dementia cases reported every year (World Health Organization, 2023). 

CLEMENTIA aims to address these gaps and challenges by proposing a technology-enabled intervention for objectively assessing and monitoring pain and consciousness levels and detecting the emotional state of advanced dementia patients in need of palliative care. Proposed technologies will be used to assist clinical decisions on symptom identification, recognition, and management according to each individual patient’s needs, enabling therefore the provision of personalised care. Moreover, in cases of unresponsive/uncommunicative patients whose cognitive ability to process information is not wholly impaired, technological solutions will be used for the real-time detection of patients’ emotional states. Such information can provide insights into the effectiveness of medical practices and interventions and can contribute towards the alleviation of suffering at the ends of patients’ lives. A number of clinical studies will be undertaken to realise the CLEMENTIA aim. First, a qualitative co-creation study (CLEMENTIA-CS) and a data collection and feasibility study (CLEMENTIA-DFS) will be undertaken. Then, a multicentre randomised controlled trial (CLEMETIA-mRCT) involving five palliative care dementia centres in Italy, France, Romania, Switzerland and Greece will be conducted. These studies will contribute towards the development and the evaluation of the effectiveness of the proposed intervention in improving the quality of life of advanced dementia patients.  In addition, several other critical parameters will be explored, including (i) the cost-effectiveness of the proposed intervention, (ii) its potential in increasing health equity across the populations of participating countries in terms of access to palliative care for advanced dementia patients, and (iii) its potential in reducing caregiver burden. In line with these methods and strategies, and the proposed technology-driven intervention, CLEMENTIA aspires to advance the care provided to European  advanced dementia patients so that it meets each individual patient’s needs and improves their quality of life at the end of life.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2023-HUMAN-01-01
fields.title: An Adaptive Serverless Framework for Minimizing Data Requirements in AI pipelines
fields.abstract:
The vision of DALESS is to make the best of existing computing infrastructure, available raw and processed data offering a unified
framework that will allow users to reuse existing data and computing assets in a low-intrusive programmable and efficient way. The
goal is to assist AI practitioners to focus only on implementing their ‘business’ logic using simple APIs and low-code GUIs while
DALESS will take care of the rest, i.e., optimize the execution, data-reuse in the underlying cloud-to-edge continuum. Towards that,
DALESS aims to provide a universal platform, data management technologies and AI models through a low-code cloud-enabled
serverless programming model adopted during both the development (existing IDE/coding libraries, graphical models, flow-based
programming models, etc.), and the deployment lifecycles (i.e., deploy AI algorithms, deliver new functions to the edge, etc). DALESS
will automatically decide upon the size/scale of the execution environment, the required infrastructure, centralized vs distributed
implementations etc. DALESS aims at breaking the silos imposed by different data processing systems, different scheduling software
and heterogeneous hardware and offer an end-to-end, IoT-to-Edge-to-Cloud full-stack approach towards an automated pipeline of
general-purpose data analytics and AI tasks in any industrial setting. DALESS will interface with the underlying platforms and devices
providing a seamless execution platform. AI practitioners will be able to adopt a plethora of software libraries, execution
environments and hardware without knowing in detail the “internals” of the operations in a transparent hardware-agnostic approach.
Through the high number of use cases (i.e., four), DALESS will validate a set of diverse data management functionalities relying on a
DataOps approach to build on personalized declarative pipelines.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2023-Twin Transition-01-04
fields.title: A Collaborative Remanufacturing framework based on Sustainable Product Life Cycle management
fields.abstract: Core5.0 will deliver a framework that will enable cutting-edge, collaborative remanufacturing approaches to be directly applied and integrated into value chains; it will deploy a platform enabling collaborative design and remanufacturing between manufacturing industries: thus, remanufacturing processes will take place not only in the factory level, but also in the value chain level and between different value chains. The envisioned platform will offer: (i) collaborative logistics for managing and planning the most efficient and sustainable remanufacturing operations as a service; (ii) value-chain remanufacturing by-design: protocols and procedures for future products to be easily re-manufactured; (iii) an interoperable and trustworthy data sharing mechanism, building on existing ontologies and metadata from operational collaborative manufacturing frameworks, to facilitate the vision of collaborative remanufacturing; (iv) an AI-based, value-chain level simulation environment exploiting aggregated, collaborative knowledge and delivering remanufacturing scenarios for complementary procedures (including disassembly processes) and complemented by thorough economic, environmental and societal assessments; (v) intelligent, adjustable human-centric interfaces to ensure the full exploitation of human-AI collaboration and deliver applicable and comprehensive Decision Support towards the most efficient actions regarding disassembly, remanufacturing or repurposing; (vi) a ‘social inclusion’ module aiming at actively engaging consumers in the loop and educating them on the proper use of products, familiarizing them with the concept of re-using and re-purposing, offering at the same time a remanufacturing Data Space – Digital Product Passport (DPP) towards this direction; and (vii) a set of upskilling mechanisms for different types of workers, operators and managers throughout the value chains.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2023-DIGITAL-EMERGING-01
fields.title: INTELLIGENT INTERVENTION IN UNDERWATER ROBOTIC
fields.abstract:
The INteLligent InterveNtion in undErwater Robotics (INLIER) project aims at revolutionising underwater intervention practices by
endowing marine vehicles with an increasing degree of autonomy and by cutting the expenses of research vessels. In INLIER we will
develop a remote teleoperation/monitoring framework based on Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) that will transport intervention
robots on site and act as high-bandwidth communication gateways between them and the control room, conveniently kept on shore.
Through the control room, mission operators will be able to monitor fully autonomous operations or to take control if needed either
manually or in a shared autonomy mode. The implementation of the shared autonomy mode will be based on the detection of the
operator's intention through a set of wearable devices and on the haptic feedback from the robots' sensors. The project will target
both industrial and scientific application scenarios and will make significant progresses also in the design of specialized grippers to
handle delicate and deformable biological specimen. The consortium is made of several partners from six European countries with
strong expertise in underwater robotics and sensing, human-robot interaction, advanced control electronics, marine biology and
offshore operations. Although INLIER will target marine operations, for which there is a global growing interest and which represent
the ultimate frontier of terrestrial exploration, its results will be applicable also to other domains such as surgical robotics, precision
agriculture and space exploration.

fields.thematic_areas: TWIN-TRANSITION-01-42
fields.title: Upcycling strategies for circularity of end-of-life-products and secondary materials from wastes or residues for manufacturing and process industries
fields.abstract: The vision of CIRCULess is to develop and demonstrate solutions and strategies in support of a new paradigm for the management and use of secondary resources from wastes/residues in the process industry leading to products with identical properties and performances as those produced using primary resources. This paradigm will substantially reduce the opportunity cost of recycling and upcycling strategies (both money-wise and resource-wise) by allowing relatively-end-of-life products to be reused for production the same quality and diversity of products as those obtained when using primary resources. Such new strategies will contribute to a more sustainable, circular and resource-friendly asset management and, at the same time, offer economic and competitive advantages to the process industries. To achieve the above, a Decision Support Engine will be developed to accumulate knowledge of the status of secondary resources (e.g., materials properties through characterization, LCA/LCC assessment, etc.) and propose innovative methods, tools or services for the appropriate upcycling activity. The CIRCULess solution with its planned activities addresses currently market needs and contributes to unleashing the full potential of sustainable and green industries, by empowering the industry to produce 2nd life products of their wastes/residues with identical properties and performances that meet fast changing market requirements. CIRCULess focuses on 100% reuse of end-of-life products, wastes/residues through. This perspective will develop knowledge-based mechanism for the collection and management of operation-related information. All the above-mentioned solutions will be demonstrated in four real industrial cases to evaluate the manufactured 2nd life products about their quality and reusability as well as the demonstrable economic return that they achieved in closed cooperation between recyclers, process industry, users and technology providers.

fields.department_role: Το τμήμα θα αναλάβει την  δημιουργία μεθοδολογιών αυτοματοποιημένης αξιολόγησης των μοντέλων ΤΝ καθώς και την ενορχήστρωση της εκτέλεσής τους.
fields.abstract:
HumAIne will research, develop, validate and promote a novel operating system for Human-AI collaboration, which will enable the
development of advanced decision making applications in dynamic, unstructured environments in different industrial sectors. The
HumAIne OS will empower AI solution integrators to implement Human-AI collaboration systems that outperform AI systems and
humans when working in isolation. The platform will handle various types of structured and unstructured data, including inputs from humans that will be semantically correlated through ontologies, knowledge graphs, and semantic interoperability.
HumAIne will complement its platform with complementary resources (e.g., training) and will be build a vibrant community of
interested parties around it, to drive exploitation and wider use of the project's results.

fields.title: Optical and wireless sensors networks for 6G scenarios
fields.department_role: Εγγραφή υποψήφιου διδάκτορα που θα υποστηρίζεται από το έργο
fields.department_staff:
Καμαλάκης Θωμάς
Μαρία Νικολαίδου
Παναγιώτης Ριζομυλιώτης
fields.abstract: In the Optical and WIreless sensors Networks for 6G scenarios (OWIN6G) project, key industry and academic stakeholders are brought together with the aim of developing a structured European training programme (TP) in optical technologies to facilitate disruptive wireless sensor applications within sixth-generation (6G) networks. OWIN6G will be the first Doctoral Network dedicated to training new generation of early-stage researchers (i.e., doctoral candidates, DCs) in the field of wireless sensor networks (WSNs) for the Internet of Things/Internet of Everything as part of the 6G and beyond focusing on novel sensors, solar-cells for energy harvesting and optical detection, and hybrid RF-optical wireless technologies, and the application of machine learning to improve adoption, optimization, and security aspects in sensor networks. OWIN6G will contribute significantly to the fundamental scientific understanding, technical know-hows and innovation of the future hybrid RF/optical WSN through the collaborative research involving ten individual DCs projects addressing specific challenges and applications. OWIN6G will make significant contributions to the fundamental scientific understanding, technical know-how and innovation of the future hybrid optical/RF sensor network. In addition to technical TP through PhD courses, dedicated tutorials and workshops organized by the Doctoral Network, DCs will be offered complementary non-technical training activities, including entrepreneurship, authoring scientific papers/patents, dissemination, etc. Having industrial partners participate will further enhance DC's technological progress by focusing on standardization, commercialization, and handling of real-world projects in a real-world environment.

fields.title: Next-Generation ASP: Foundations of Novel Logical Formalisms for Knowledge Representation
fields.department_staff: Μέλος ΔΕΠ ως επιστημονικός υπεύθυνος. Θα χρηματοδοτήσει 2 νέους ερευνητές (ίσως υποψηφίους διδάκτορες).
fields.abstract: Answer set programming (ASP) is a declarative logic programming paradigm for solving difficult computational problems. Nowadays, ASP is considered as one of the most successful formalisms of logic-based AI, having been used in many industrial-level problems. The most difficult foundational problem in ASP, is its extension in order to handle more demanding computational tasks. Any significant  extension to the expressive power of ASP that is also easy to use by programmers, will be a major breakthrough. To tackle this problem, we propose to extend ASP in two significant and orthogonal ways: to extend the underlying language from first-order to higher-order logic and to allow preferential logical operators such as ordered disjunction in the logical rules of ASP. The key tasks  of our proposal are to study the logical foundations, the expressive power, and  the computational procedures of Higher-Order ASP and Preferential ASP. Overall, the proposed project will lead to a significant advancement of one of the most broadly used formalisms in modern logical-AI.

fields.title: Palatal fold pairs: Highly individual intraoral structure serving as a potential primary identifier analogous to a fingerprint
fields.department_role: Ανάπτυξη μεθόδοων επεξεργασίας δεδομένων και τεχνητής νοημοσύνης για την εξαγωγή μοναδικών χαρακτηριστικών διανυσμάτων από τρισιδιάστατες οδοντικές τομογραφίες. Χρήση των δεδομένων αυτών για την ανάπτυξη μοντέλων πρόβλεψης χαρακτηριστικών του ατόμου.
fields.department_staff: Μέλη ΔΕΠ, υποψήφιοι διδάκτορες ή/και εξωτερικοί συνεργάτες.
fields.abstract: The overall objective of the project is the provision of a standardized, new identification component in addition to dental status, dactyloscopy and DNA comparison, which corresponds to the internationally agreed INTERPOL standard and achieves similar or higher hit ratios. The user is specifically the Federal Criminal Police Office in the context of identifying deceased persons after major incidents, as is generally the entire criminal police network entrusted with the identification of unknown deceased persons. Another factor that complicates the identification of deceased persons in scenarios mentioned below is the destruction of databases such as medical offices in affected disaster areas. A sub-goal of this research is to make the collected scan data digitally available and to prevent the destruction of databases (digital as well as analog) in case of a disaster. A cloud-based solution or the storage of scan data on central, separately secured servers is conceivable, as in the case of police databases such as INPOL Central at the Federal Criminal Police Office. If necessary, the user should be given the option of digitally comparing post-mortem scans of palatal fold pairs with the existing databases.

fields.title: ECOsystem for greeN Electronic Components and Systems in  Qatar
fields.abstract:
The main aim of the project is to reduce e-waste on a Qatari scale. To do so, the project will:
● Generate, for the first time, a clear framework aiding producers to evaluate their choices and pathways to eco-design, to foster Qatari leadership in the green transition. This will lead to an online framework that makes users record the amount of e-waste of different types they produce and recycle, and list the ways they achieve it, allowing us to make recommendations.
● Make green ECS: Provide innovative techniques for reducing, repairing, reusing, refurbishing, recycling to decrease e-waste and boost circularity in a new generation of electronics. This will lead
to the establishment of a mobile app building on consortium assets (e.g. the ERF app where users can track their recycling activities), with additional AI tools and methods.
● Showcase green solutions: Demonstrate innovation potential, usability, and versatility of the green solution along the value chain. This will lead to the establishment of 5 kiosks within the QU area, as
well as in other pre-agreed areas in Doha, motivating users to actively recycle and buy refurbished products. Also, a digital marketplace will be delivered, where users can interact with each other on buying and selling refurbished electronic devices, with motivations.
● Building consciousness: Create an ecosystem comprising a chain of stakeholders (circularity network), to empower the next ECS generation

fields.abstract: Το συγκεκριμένο έργο έχει ως στόχο την ανάπτυξη μιας νέας μεθόδου για τη μη παρεμβατική μέτρηση των επιπέδων γλυκόζης στο αίμα με τη μέθοδο της φασματογραφίας Raman. Ο στόχος είναι να κατασκευαστεί και να αξιολογηθεί ένα πρωτότυπο το οποίο θα κατασκευάζεται από προσιτά υλικά και θα μπορεί να χρησιμοποιηθεί κατ’ οίκον για τη μέτρηση γλυκόζης από άτομα που πάσχουν από διαβήτη, καθώς και προληπτικά από άτομα με φυσιολογικά επίπεδα γλυκόζης στο αίμα. Θα κατασκευαστούν νέοι οπτικοί αισθητήρες, καθώς και μέθοδοι εκτίμησης φάσματος βασισμένες σε μεθόδους μηχανικής μάθησης. Το πρωτότυπο θα κατασκευαστεί και θα αξιολογηθεί σε επίπεδο τεχνολογικής ετοιμότητας TRL-4. Η αξιολόγηση θα γίνει σε εθελοντές ασθενείς με διαβήτη στη Γερμανία.

fields.thematic_areas: Data Management
fields.title: An open-source platform for building, recommending and monitoring compliant AI pipelines
fields.department_role: HUA will mostly participate in the Fairness Lifecycle Manager work package (WP5), leading the Fairness Monitoring Task, and also contribute in the AI module work package (WP3). Our main duties will be to assess the fairness compliance of AI algorithms and/or datasets, recommend actions to improve fairness, as well as provide techniques for automatically ensuring algorithmic- and data-level fairness.
fields.department_staff: Η. Βαρλάμης, Χ. Δίου, Δ. Μιχαήλ
fields.abstract:
Core idea: Develop an open-source platform that supports three types of compliance:
- Ethical
- Environmental
- Legislative

and consists of three parts:

- AI module (Offers libraries for implementing main data-driven operations)
- Compliance recommendation module (Offers libraries for recommending compliant alternatives for non-compliant workflow steps)
- Compliance monitoring module (Offers libraries for checking whether an AI pipeline satisfies any of the 3 types of compliance)

and provides tools for data spaces.

Goal of platform: shorten the time-to-market and reduce development costs of compliant data solutions.

fields.abstract: OptimumIoT will become a catalyst for the development of a new wave of federated, cross-domain, multi-tier cloud/edge/IoT applications that will be optimized in terms of sustainability, resilience and cost. In this direction, OptimumIoT will develop a novel, open middleware infrastructure (comprising a pool of platform-level services) and accompanying tools that will lower the effort and cost required to develop, deploy, and operate multi-tier IoT services across cross-domain, cross-sector value chains. The OptimumIoT will offer functionalities for infrastructure providers, platform services providers, IoT device vendors (OEMs) and industrial end-users, lowering their effort and cost to develop, deploy and manage cross-domain cloud/edge/IoT applications and services.

fields.abstract:
Development of an antibody that specifically detects GHB is of paramount importance and a partner with expertise to the area of antibodies for small molecules will be employed (Abcalis GmbH). Nonetheless alternative binding molecules, such as aptamers, will be also explored. For the built up of the WLRS system the Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology of NCSR “Demokritos” will collaborate with ThetaMetrisis S.A. to optimize the system for the requirements of the particular application especially those related to system portability and robustness. The Immunoassays/Immunosensors Lab of INRASTES, NCSR “Demokritos” will undertake the development of binding assays for detection of GHB
with the optical methods and perform the initial evaluation of the three biosensing approaches. Electrochemical sensors will be fabricated by Jobst Technologies GmbH which will also develop and the measuring apparatus.

fields.department_role: BUsiness models, exploitation, participation in the implementation of services within the dataspaces
fields.department_staff:
G. Dimitrakopoulos
E. Liotou
E. Politi
I. Vondikakis
fields.abstract: UNDERPIN addresses the vision of European Digital Single Market with the idea of a European-wide Data Space for Manufacturing for dynamic asset management and predictive/prescriptive maintenance. European manufacturers in the refinery and renewable energy domains, their value chain ecosystem of SMEs and governmental, research and civil society stakeholders will be equipped with sustainable and secure yet user friendly Data Space aiming at improving processes, cost structure and material management via beyond the state-of-the-art data analysis. The solution is compliant to EU standards, Data acts, IDSA and GAIA-X guidelines encompassing enterprise-ready infrastructure and tools to accommodate secure and trusted data, improving company operations. UNDERPIN Data Space will provide a cross-organizational and cross-use-case data sharing and exchanging, a solution that ensures data sovereignty, with strong focus on the interplay of SMEs and large industry players to improve products and services. Real world demonstrators in the demanding and diverse oil refinery and wind farm domains will be implemented. UNDERPIN will ensure higher performance, better insight on asset critically, reduced overall downtimes and maintenance costs, extended machine usage periods, improved future machine designs, new service models, improve production line operations, company-internal processes, increased usability and enhance business opportunities for industrial data value added services, supporting the transition towards circular economy. UNDERPIN will make use of existing embryonic data space of the lead partner Motor Oil. This will be transferred to existing mature Data Space technology to ensure security, interoperability, scalability, high performance, increased usability, standards compliance. UNDERPIN develops a trust framework, a sustainable business model for the Data Space operator Motor Oil, and implements a Europe-wide scale-out plan to establish a European Data Space for Manufacturing.

- Θεόδωρος Θεοδωρόπουλος
- Ιωάννης Κοντόπουλος
- Θέκλα Καφατάρη
fields.abstract: EdgeZ aspires to implement a truly zero-touch, lift-and-shift migration solution for OCI-based containerized application workflows on top of a federation of cloud/edge continuum resources. Such a solution will alleviate the application providers from the burden of re-engineering their applications to host it in a platform that would allow them to locate a profitable niche in edge computing, igniting a value chain that can be proven lucrative for EU SME cloud providers. To achieve that, EdgeZ pushes the innovation envelop towards 2 directions: a) enabling the deployment of hyper-distributed application workflows without touching the code and only on the basis of the declaration of high level semantics and b) automatically identifying lifecycle changes and orchestrating resources and services in response. Towards that direction the consortium employs AI-techniques as key-enablers: the generative power of DNNs allows to harness vast amounts of monitoring data and isolate the parameters that characterize the lifecycle changes and to generate the appropriate orchestration models without human interference. As such, EdgeZ creates a feedback loop following a Deep Reinforcement Learning paradigm, to implement a cognitive orchestrator and complements it with proactive placement features. To demonstrate the novel abilities of the cognitive orchestrator, EdgeZ attempts to navigate an essential tradeoff between QoE and energy representing the needs of the application providers and the infrastructure owners from an edge computing platform correspondingly. The project results, the EdgeZ platform with the cognitive orchestrator and the zNode sw stack will be used to host a variety of high-impact use case scenarios ranging from QoE-intensive collaborative VR, AI-based XR telepresence, security-enabled industrial IoT and data-intensive earth observational processing pipelines supported by 2 SMEs and 2 multinationals. The final solution will form the core of an open source project.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL3-2021-FCT-01-10: Fight against firearms trafficking
fields.title: Advanced versatile artificial intelligence technologies and interconnected cross-sectoral fully-operational national focal points for combating illicit firearms trafficking
fields.department_role: Ευθύνη για τον τεχνικό συντονισμό του έργου.Έρευνα και ανάπτυξη μεθόδων υπολογιστικής όρασης για σημασιολογική ανάλυση εικόνων από το διαδίκτυο και εικόνων ακτινών Χ για ανίχνευση αντικειμένων σχετιζόμενα με δραστηριότητες διακίνησης όπλων.
fields.abstract: Ceasefire targets the development of a highly innovative, holistic, multi-disciplinary, high-tech and versatile approach for significantly increasing/broadening the operational capabilities of EU Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) in their struggle to detect, analyze and track cross-border illicit firearms trafficking related activities. In particular, Ceasefire efforts will concentrate on the following major driving axes: a) The development of advanced Artificial Intelligence (ΑΙ) technologies for significantly facilitating the everyday work of the involved practitioners, and b) The establishment of fully-operational National Focal Points (NFPs), by targeting to alleviate from current organizational, operational, cooperation, legal, cross-jurisdictional, trans-border and information exchange challenges. The former corresponds to a wide set of AI-enabled tools, including solutions for cyber patrolling, Web data gathering, on-the-spot detection of firearms, advanced Big Data analytics, cryptocurrency analysis, large-scale information fusion, visual analytics and firearms-related intelligence collection. On the other hand, particular attention will be given towards defining models, protocols and procedures for making NFPs fully functional, complemented by activities for mapping the various legal frameworks (within different countries) and procedures (within different agencies) for harmonizing investigations, cooperation, lawful evidence collection and forensics analysis. The development of efficient information sharing mechanisms among LEA (police, border guard, customs), judicial and forensics authorities will further reinforce the system capabilities. Moreover, the tasks of Ceasefire will complement the objectives and activities of the EU Policy Cycle (EMPACT) – Firearms (where partner MIRPN acts as Driver and partner FMI as Co-driver), while continuous guidance from the European Firearms Experts (EFE) group (where partner PSP acts as the Chair) is foreseen.

fields.abstract: Το συγκεκριμένο έργο έχει ως στόχο την ανάπτυξη μιας νέας μεθόδου για τη μη παρεμβατική μέτρηση των επιπέδων γλυκόζης στο αίμα με τη μέθοδο της φασματογραφίας Raman. Ο στόχος είναι να κατασκευαστεί και να αξιολογηθεί ένα πρωτότυπο το οποίο θα κατασκευάζεται από προσιτά υλικά και θα μπορεί να χρησιμοποιηθεί κατ’ οίκον για τη μέτρηση γλυκόζης από άτομα που πάσχουν από διαβήτη, καθώς και προληπτικά από άτομα με φυσιολογικά επίπεδα γλυκόζης στο αίμα. Θα κατασκευαστούν νέοι οπτικοί αισθητήρες, καθώς και μέθοδοι εκτίμησης φάσματος βασισμένες σε μεθόδους μηχανικής μάθησης. Το πρωτότυπο θα κατασκευαστεί και θα αξιολογηθεί σε επίπεδο τεχνολογικής ετοιμότητας TRL-4. Η αξιολόγηση θα γίνει σε ασθενείς και φυσιολογικούς εθελοντές στη Γερμανία και την Ελλάδα.

fields.title: Digitalization by Intelligence for Power Electronic within Value Chains
fields.abstract: The overarching goal of PowerizeD is to develop breakthrough technology for digitized and intelligent power electronics to enable sustainable and resilient energy generation, transmission and applications. PowerizeD enhances the level of mechanical and electrical integration of the control, the driver and the switch functionality in one component and allows, for the first time, a joint optimization of all power switch functionalities. The usage of new circuit models, advanced control strategies and artificial intelligence enables the integration of parts of the control loop, leading to a robust and reliable operation. To facilitate data sharing along the value chain, PowerizeD drives the novel approach of Federated Learning. This collaborative optimization of specific compact models and neural networks provides a methodical approach to an intrinsically encrypted transfer of confidential and proprietary data.

fields.title: Ανάπτυξη και αξιοποίηση ψηφιακών βιοδεικτών για τον καρκίνο μέσω κατανεμημένης πλατφόρμας ΤΝ
fields.department_role: Τεχνητή νοημοσύνη για την ανάλυση βιολογικών και απεικονιστικών δεδομένων για την εξαγωγή βιοδεικτών σχετικών με τον καρκίνο
fields.department_staff: Χρήστος Δίου (ΔΕΠ, Τμήμα Πληροφορικής και Τηλεματικής), Γεώργιος Δεδούσης (ΔΕΠ Τμήμα Επιστήμης Διαιτολογίας και Διατροφής), υποψήφιοι διδάκτορες
fields.abstract:
Ο καρκίνος είναι μια χρόνια, μη μεταδοτική ασθένεια που θεωρείται μείζον πρόβλημα
δημόσιας υγείας παγκοσμίως. Στην πρόταση αυτή θα διερευνηθούν διακριτές,
αντιπροσωπευτικές περιπτώσεις, σχετιζόμενες με το φύλο, τη συχνότητα εμφάνισης, τον
τρόπο ζωής αλλά και τη δυσκολία διάγνωσης/αντιμετώπισης, στοχεύοντας στην επιτάχυνση
και διευκόλυνση της διαδικασίας λήψης απόφασης αλλα και την εξατομικευμένη ιατρική.
Μια σειρά από βιοδείκτες χρησιμοποιούνται ως εργαλεία παρακολούθησης, διαλογής,
διαγνωστικά και προγνωστικά, ενώ μπορούν επίσης να θεωρηθούν ως πιθανοί στόχοι
φαρμάκων. Καθώς οι μεμονωμένων βιοδείκτες και παράγοντες κινδύνου που έχουν
προταθεί, μόνο εν μέρει αντικατοπτρίζουν τα υπό μελέτη φαινόμενα, θα χρησιμοποιηθούν
προηγμένες μέθοδοι που βασίζονται στην ενοποιημένη ανάλυση απεικονιστικών και
συνοδών κλινικών/βιολογικών και συμπεριφορικών δεδομένων και τη χρήση της τεχνητής
νοημοσύνης για τη δημιουργία βελτιωμένων μοντέλων πρόβλεψης. Η χρήση
ολοκληρωμένων προσεγγίσεων θα οδηγήσει επομένως σε ψηφιακούς βιοδείκτες που είναι
μετρήσιμοι, συγκεκριμένοι/ευαίσθητοι και προγνωστικοί, οπως επισης και οικονομικά
αποδοτικοί.
Στην κατεύθυνση αυτή της δημιουργίας μια διαδικασιών εύρεσης και αξιοποίησης ψηφιακών
βιοδεικτών, θα αντιμετωπιστούν προκλήσεις σχετικές με (1) Δυνατότητα αξιοποίησης
δεδομένων με ασφάλεια, (2) Ενοποίηση και ποιότητα δεδομένων, (3) Δημιουργία εύρωστων
και αξιόπιστων μοντέλων ΤΝ, 4) Ενσωμάτωση ψηφιακών βιοδεικτών στην κλινική πράξη.
Το έργο στοχεύει στη δημιουργία μιας κατανεμημένης πλατφόρμας που θα επιτρέπει στον
κλινικό γιατρό να αξιοποιεί πολλαπλά απεικονιστικά - κλινικοβιολογικα - συμπεριφορικά
δεδομένα για τον υπολογισμό έμπιστων ψηφιακών βιοδεικτων διάγνωσης και πρόγνωσης
του καρκίνου, με ασφάλεια και εμπιστευτικότητα, ενσωματώνοντας επίσης την υπάρχουσα
ιατρική γνώση.
Θα επιτρέπει επίσης τη δημιουργία νέων ψηφιακών βιοδεικτών προς αξιολόγηση και
περαιτέρω ενσωμάτωση στην κλινική πράξη, χρησιμοποιώντας μεθόδους ΤΝ και
αξιοποιώντας διαθέσιμα δεδομένα καθώς και συνθετικά δεδομένα.

Quantum mechanics

fields.title: Artificial Intelligence using Quantum measured Information for realtime distributed systems at the edge
fields.abstract:
Global environmental issues, social inequality and geopolitical changes will pose numerous problems for our society in the future. To
face these new challenges and deal with them, there is a need to understand and appropriately utilize new digital technologies such
as artificial intelligence (AI), the Internet of Things (IoT), robotics and biotechnologies.
A-IQ Ready proposes cutting-edge quantum sensing, edge continuum orchestration of AI and distributed collaborative intelligence
technologies to implement the vision of intelligent and autonomous ECS for the digital age. Quantum magnetic flux and gyro sensors
enable highest sensitivity and accuracy without any need for calibration, offer unmatched properties when used in combination with
a magnetic field map. Such a localization system will enhance the timing and accuracy of the autonomous agents and will reduce
false alarms or misinformation by means of AI and multi-agent system concepts. As a priority, the communication guidance and
decision making of groups of agents need to be based on cutting-edge technologies. Edge continuum orchestration of AI will allow
decentralizing the development of applications, while ensuring an optimal use of the available resources. Combined with the
quantum sensors, the edge continuum will be equipped with innovative, multi-physical capabilities to sense the environment,
generating “slim” but accurate measurements. Distributed intelligence will enable emergent behavior and massive collaboration of
multiple agents towards a common goal. By exploring the synergies of these cutting-edge technologies through civil safety and
security, digital health, smart logistics for supply chains and propulsion use cases, A-IQ Ready will provide the basis for the digital
society in Europe based on values, moving towards the ideal of Society 5.0.

fields.department_role: Το τμήμα θα αναλάβει την  δημιουργία μεθοδολογιών αυτοματοποιημένης αξιολόγησης των μοντέλων ΤΝ καθώς και την ενορχήστρωση της εκτέλεσής τους.
fields.abstract:
HumAIne will research, develop, validate and promote a novel operating system for Human-AI collaboration, which will enable the
development of advanced decision making applications in dynamic, unstructured environments in different industrial sectors. The
HumAIne OS will empower AI solution integrators to implement Human-AI collaboration systems that outperform AI systems and
humans when working in isolation. The platform will handle various types of structured and unstructured data, including inputs from humans that will be semantically correlated through ontologies, knowledge graphs, and semantic interoperability.
HumAIne will complement its platform with complementary resources (e.g., training) and will be build a vibrant community of
interested parties around it, to drive exploitation and wider use of the project's results.

fields.abstract: Interdict proposes a novel approach for monitoring and intrusion detection and prevention, tailored to complex, heterogeneous and ultra-distributed Cloud architectures, from hierarchical, distributed and multi-layered Cloud organisational topologies to ever-shifting Future Internet infrastructures. Interdict a) exploit AI-powered, real-time and multimodal information retrieval and aggregation from open data sources, complemented with b) unified and homogenised cybersecurity and personal data protection data models, in order to enable: c) the intelligent, network- and system-wide detection and early prediction of cyber threats; d) a comprehensive deployment and orchestration of interdependent and perpetually updated cybersecurity resources and e) a faster and better-informed response to incidents.

fields.department_role: HUA will develop a toolset for federated cloud-edge service orchestration with auto-organisation of tasks and resources. Will develop new improved algorithms and integrate them with mature industrial tools. Will lead WP4 and have a key role in WP2.
fields.department_staff: Ηρακλής Βαρλάμης, Κώστας Τσερπές, Δημήτρης Μιχαήλ, Ιωάννης Κοντόπουλος, Χρήστος Σαρδιανός, Χρήστος Χρόνης, Άρτεμις Στεφανίδου, Γιώργος Αναγνωστόπουλος
fields.abstract:
Manufacturing, construction, and agriculture are major driving forces for the European economy and prosperity. Maintaining its
competitiveness in these sectors demands highly efficient and flexible processes, and this can be achieved through digitization. Novel
intelligent robotic capabilities that can be deployed side-by-side with humans and can operate and adapt to dynamic environments
can accelerate this process. However, existing robotic systems cannot fit well into such settings as they are not versatile and flexible
enough to automate certain tasks, cannot collaborate safely with humans in open and dynamic environments, nor are they easily and
economically adaptable to process changes.
The SOPRANO project coalesces multidisciplinary research and innovation in human-robot collaboration and intelligent multi-agent
systems, aspiring to design the next generation of manufacturing floors, construction sites, and agri-food production, where humans
and intelligent machines will seamlessly work together. It proposes to scale collaboration from the single human-agent dyad to a
peer-based synergy between multiple interconnected robotic systems featuring different physical and cognitive properties,
supporting various tasks in collaboration with human workers, robotics and other agents.
SOPRANO will validate the technological offering in three novel and open-access use cases addressing both large-scale industries and
small to medium enterprises, adding value to EU key sectors and instrumenting community building surrounding the open-source
technologies in the EU industrial ecosystem. During the project, we will also enable external SMEs and start-ups to benefit from the
project technologies via an open call, which will enable the building of demonstrators using SOPRANO technologies that will open
new market opportunities for their products and services.

fields.title: Teaching AI to higher education students using an open-source and opendesign educational robot
fields.department_role: Επέκταση του FOSSBot SW/HW, Σχεδίαση Εκπ. υλικού και δραστηριοτήτων, διάχυση
fields.department_staff:
Ηρακλής Βαρλάμης
Χρήστος Χρόνης
Δημήτρης Χαρίτος
Γιώργος Καζάζης
fields.abstract:
FOSSBot is an Open Source and Open Design Educational Robot that is developed in collaboration of GFOSS and the Harokopio University of Athens. All the 3D designs and the code for the operation of the robot are freely available on GFOSS GitHub allowing anyone to download them, print all parts, assemble the robot with its electronic departments, install its operating software and also to improve it. The operation of the robot is based on a Raspberry Pi and a software stack in Python resulting in a graphical programming interface 
of the robot with Blockly. FOSSBot is a completely open and cost-effective alternative to commercial solution series for educational robotics making it available to use without significant infrastructure and resources. 
There is a need for a hands-on learning approach that utilizes cost-effective and easy-to-use educational robotics to offer project-based education on the topics of AI, ML, NLP, electronics, embedded systems, python programming, algorithms, computer vision, cyber security and IoT, while enabling experimentation and prototyping and putting the student at the centre of the learning process. Using the AI4K12 initiative, it is possible to develop an educational course based on the 5 Big Ideas in AI framework, to introduce higher education students to these complex topics in an-easy-to-understand and stimulating fashion, utilizing the FOSSBot as the main teaching tool. The AI4K12 initiative is targeting K12 education in terms of the content and resources it provides to educators. However, the approach is
ingenious and excellent also for a HE approach to AI & robotics as it focuses on the practical aspects and the impact of these technologies to our everyday life.

fields.abstract: FOSSBot is a project with enormous potential to revolutionize STEM education by introducing students to robotics and programming in an accessible and affordable way. In terms of the project FOSSBot will become multilingual, will be expanded with a few more sensors and will be enriched with educational material and supporting activities. It will also be ported in a simulation environment (such as CoppeliaSim or Gazebo) in order to support the quick onboarding of educators and students.  The educational material and activities developed for FOSSbot will provide a structured approach to learning, making it easier for educators to incorporate robot-based activities and programming concepts into their curriculum. The material will be designed to be accessible to students with different skill levels, allowing them to progress at their own pace. The activities will be designed to be engaging and interactive, encouraging students to explore and experiment with the concepts they are learning.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2023-DIGITAL-EMERGING-01
fields.title: AUTOnomous AI-enabled heterogeneous Multi-robot Teams Adaptive in the Long-Term
fields.department_staff:
Επ. Καθ. Γεώργιος Θ. Παπαδόπουλος
Αν. Καθ. Γεώργιος Δημητρακόπουλος
fields.abstract:
Automat will develop an innovative, multitask platform, able to automatically configure and deploy on its own a team of multiple,
cloud/AI-enabled, autonomous and cooperative robots, which are potentially heterogeneous and varying in capabilities. They will be
characterized by long-term autonomy and, according to current needs, equally capable of closely interacting with humans in social
settings, or operating in relative isolation under only very high-level human-set goals. The Automat platform will incorporate
advanced AI/machine learning and robotics methods in the form of an Adaptive Intelligence Toolkit, containing a wide range of
ground-breaking novel algorithms that jointly and synergistically contribute to long-term autonomy, based on 3 complementary
axes: i) autonomously configured/deployed Multi-Robot Teams for automatic adjustment to changing tasks, by exploiting
heterogeneity and complementarity of robots, ii) self-adaptive AI for automatic adjustment to changing conditions, and iii) collective
intelligence for autonomous and robust propagation of novel knowledge across the entire platform, via Federated Learning. Automat
robots will be able to robustly cooperate on their own to solve challenging, time-varying problems in dynamic environments, with
any novel knowledge gained by individual robots during a mission becoming automatically available to others. They will support safe
physical interactions with the environment and multimodal (visual, verbal) personalized communication with nearby humans,
adjusting to dynamic contexts without explicit supervision. The system will provide optional learning-from-demonstration if a robot
fails in a new task, so that novel skills are acquired on-line and then propagated autonomously via the collective intelligence layer.
Automat will be validated at TRL-5 in 3 real-world scenarios: ship inner hull inspection/maintenance (shipyard), palliative patient care
(hospital) and retailer order fulfillment (supermarket).

fields.abstract:
E-Tawfeer is an extension of the (EM)3 framework that was succesfully completed with QU and aims to further advance research findings in the three pillars, namely technological improvements, new business models and marketability assessment and consumer empowerment solutions. The project objectives are: 
- to examine in depth the new opportunities that arise from the AI and micro-moment based recommendations in the energy efficiency domain and achieve technological and scientific improvements, in terms of edge computing, security and privacy and continual learning,
- to tackle the open issues and challenges associated with the implementation of recommendation-based behavior change interventions for energy efficiency and the empowerment of consumers, and
- to take the outcomes achieved in (EM)3 in each pillar many steps further, thus enhancing the business models, adding new dimensions to the existing ecosystem, and creating new exploitation and application opportunities, in the energy and other domains.

fields.thematic_areas: Semiconductors
fields.title: True Demand-Driven Semiconductor Supply Chains for Europe
fields.department_role: Σχεδιασμός και ανάπτυξη αλγορίθμων και λογισμικού λήψης αποφάσεων για συστήματα ημιαγωγών
fields.abstract:
SC4EU, a collaborative Innovation Action aims at strengthening European digital sovereignty by mitigation of the chip shortage through reduction of bullwhip effect in the semiconductor industry and supply chains containing semiconductors. This will be reached via a “truer”-demand signal gained from an anonymous MPC (Multi-Party Computation) survey on coarse granularity which will be broken down via AI methods to fine granularities following the semantic web based digital reference structure.

The bullwhip effect has led to a range of negative outcomes, including excessive inventory, inventory write-offs, decreased revenue, workforce reduction, and ultimately, significant shortages, as observed in the last COVID years, during the financial crisis in 08/09 and during the .com crisis in the Zero Years.

The ambition of SC4EU consortium is to overcome these obstacles and to obtain high-quality, reliable data for semiconductor demand forecasting. In the solution proposed by SC4EU, data should be gathered via an anonymous survey based on Multi-Party Computing technology. Anonymity and security of data flow will encourage business partners to share their true demand data. Then, the gathered data will be mapped onto ontologies (semantic representations of the semiconductor industry) and processed with AI tools for demand breakdown of fine granularity.

In essence, SC4EU will deliver:
•	An improved version of the Digital Reference ecosystem and ensure its maintenance
•	A secure access to the true demand forecasting services and integrate them with cloud services and other dataspaces
•	Collaborative ontology processing tools into the SC4EU Ontology Curation Portal and availability of continuous integration pipelines
•	Collaborative ontology editing and visualisation tooling
•	Establishment of an integrated SSO solution for all SC4EU Portal connected tools
•	A consistent, modular and semantic description of semiconductor supply chains that can be used to generate meaningful demand forecasts for the supply chain
•	The design and the test of demand forecasting methods that especially allow to disaggregate demand information
•	The survey use case
•	True demand forecasts on coarse granularity and derive from it with AI methods and the Semantic Web-based Digital Reference semiconductor industry forecasts on finer granularity
•	Establish a technical implementation of the anonymous survey using Multi-Party Computation technology
•	An Incentivisation for partners to foster participation in anonymous survey in order to obtain data
•	Promotion of the use of the data sharing platform amongst the semiconductor supply chain organisations

SC4EU will result in a better bullwhip reduced demand forecast on all levels of the semiconductor demand and of demands for supply chains containing semiconductors. By that reduced chip shortage in boom phases and less oversupply, unused capacity and waste in phases of low demand. KPIs are:
•	A metric to measure the bullwhip effect
•	A reduction of the bullwhip effect of 20% within the project time to the status of the average five years before the project last of three years and a roadmap to reduce the bullwhip to 50% within the next three years to the reference period (thus another 10% per year)
•	An economic metric to measure the impact of the reduced bullwhip on the entire semiconductor ecosystem. Confirming the estimation that 2% bullwhip reduction delivers 1% Forecast accuracy gain, which is 0,1% Cost of Sales/year gain     
•	An ecologic metric connecting CO2 savings to reduced bullwhip, increased Forecast Accuracy, less chip shortage, less underutilization and using earlier    research that the CO2 output as with each semiconductor consuming a CO2 unit during its production a multiple of it is saved in its application. In this respect confirming the SC4EU abbreviation meaning - Saved CO2 with Semantically Connected SemiConductor Supply Chains
 
SC4EU is a pan-European initiative to boost industrial competitiveness through interdisciplinary innovations, establishing sustainable ECS value chains and therefore contribute to European digital sovereignty addressing urgent issues like security of supply, monitoring and crisis response, and chip shortage.

fields.thematic_areas: Remanufacturing, technology acceptance
fields.title: REmanufacturing, repurposing and recycling energy goods through advanced Mechatronic and Digital  technologies
fields.abstract:
Despite the multiple advantages of products remanufacturing, being widely recognised as an effective means for transitioning to a 
more circular economy, there is still need for improved research and experimental observations, to improve traceability and reliability 
of the final products from end-users’ perspectives, as well as enhanced impacts monitoring. The primary R3-Mydas objective is to 
develop a multi-actor framework, integrating innovative digital technologies (ML for process and quality control, marketplace, graph 
models for defects detection, digital twins), advanced mechatronics (AM, laser-cladding, automated disassembly/reassembly) and 
newly developed approaches from SSH (extended TAM/UTAUT models, ethics and legal framework), for functionally, environmentally 
and economically sustainable circular value chains for remanufacturing of energy goods at the factory level (Oil&Gas crankshafts – 
demo 1, E-vehicles batteries – demo 2, Wind turbines gearboxes – demo 3). R3-Mydas will deliver unprecedented impacts throughout 
the targeted value chains, as follows: up to 60% time reduction in programming for remanufacturing; up to 20% increased product 
quality; up to 30% rework reduction [Demo 1]; up to 30% improved detection of tiny deviations from normal behaviour; up to 50% 
faster anomaly localization; up to 30% increase the number of different modality data streams handled; up to 20% faster fusion 
process [Demo 2]; up to 99% reusage rate; -90% prevention rate; -75% lead time; up to 85% raw material savings potential [Demo 3]. 
The Project will deliver a marketplace associating to each remanufactured product or services/component for remanufacturing a 
Digital Passport-like set of information, ensuring full traceability. Finally, a dedicated training programme will be designed and 
delivered by EITM, targeting the Project remanufacturing value chains (100+ training hours and 100+ diverse stakeholders engaged 
during the Project).

fields.title: A harmonized European forensics approach on drugs analysis
fields.abstract:
Development of an antibody that specifically detects GHB is of paramount
importance and a partner with expertise to the area of antibodies for small molecules will be employed
(Abcalis GmbH). Nonetheless alternative binding molecules, such as aptamers, will be also explored. For the
built up of the WLRS system the Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology of NCSR “Demokritos” will
collaborate with ThetaMetrisis S.A. to optimize the system for the requirements of the particular application
especially those related to system portability and robustness. The Immunoassays/Immunosensors Lab of
INRASTES, NCSR “Demokritos” will undertake the development of binding assays for detection of GHB
with the optical methods and perform the initial evaluation of the three biosensing approaches.
Electrochemical sensors will be fabricated by Jobst Technologies GmbH which will also develop and the
measuring apparatus.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL3-2023-FCT-01-04: “Open Topic”
fields.title: AI-boosted digital twin-as-a-security-service for public space protection
fields.abstract: AEGIS targets the development of a highly innovative, holistic, multi-disciplinary, high-tech and versatile approach for significantly increasing/broadening the operational capabilities of police authorities in their struggle to efficiently protect public places from terrorist attacks. In particular, AEGIS efforts will concentrate on the following major driving axes: a) The development of advanced Artificial Intelligence (ΑΙ) technologies for significantly facilitating the operational work and effectiveness of the involved practitioners and stakeholders, and b) The design of a so-called ‘Digital Twin-as-a-Security-Service (DTaaSS)’ architecture, which extends/elaborates the ‘Security by Design’ approach with an AI-boosted Internet-of-Things (IoT) conceptualization for realizing area monitoring, event detection and attack prediction.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL3-2023-CS-01-03
fields.title: Agile AI Systems Risk and Conformance Assessment mitigated by Adaptive Defences and Controls
fields.abstract:
MIMESIS will integrate the Human-as-a-
Security-Sensor (HaaSS) concept into Reinforcement Learning (RL) tasks, adaptive defence strategies
and control mechanisms to mitigate the risks of AI systems. The best chance to achieve impactful end-to-
end solutions to real life problems is to validate these advancements with conversational humanoids for
elderly care and special education, swarms and drones coordination for surveillance military applications
and vessels transceivers for safer maritime operations.

fields.call: HORIZON-CL3-2023-CS-01-01 - Secure Computing Continuum (IoT, Edge, Cloud, Dataspaces)
fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL3-2023-CS-01-01 - Secure Computing Continuum (IoT, Edge, Cloud, Dataspaces)
fields.title: Large Language Models for Securing cOmputing Continuum
fields.abstract: LLM4SOC will provide a holistic service-based ecosystem for securing the computing continuum based on four main pillars: (a) Preparedness, (b) Detection, (c) Response and (d) Trust. For each pillar, appropriate and adjustable LLMs will be implemented in order to optimise the role of the corresponding security controls. In particular, in the first pillar, LLMs will be utilised for vulnerability assessment, indicating and providing appropriate remediation solutions (e.g., patch management, configuration changes and compensating controls).

fields.call:
Arts and cultural awareness and expression in education and training
HORIZON-CL2-2024-TRANSFORMATIONS-01-08
fields.thematic_areas: Education, Educational Robotics
fields.title: TRANSDISCIPLINARY AND INTEGRATIVE APPROACH TO ASSESS IMPACT AND FOSTER ARTS AND CULTURAL AWARENESS AND EXPRESSION IN  EDUCATION
fields.department_role: HUA will promote the use of robotics to enhance arts-based methods  utilizing an existing open-source and open-design robot, FOSSbot (an educational robot that uses open software and hardware and can be employed in all levels of education), which will be adapted to be able to introduce new activities related to the use of AiE.
fields.department_staff:
Ηρακλής Βαρλάμης
Χρύσα Σοφιανοπούλου
Υ/Δ και Μεταδιδάκτορες του τμήματος
fields.abstract:
Arts-Express acknowledges the importance of the use of arts in
education and the development of cultural awareness and expression, one of the recognized key competencies for lifelong learning by the EC 16 . Therefore, its goal is to effectively contribute with evidence to both identify challenges across education and training systems in supporting learners to develop cultural awareness and expression, and to better understand and assess both the impact of AiE and support for partnerships (e.g., between education institutions and arts and cultural heritage organisations). Based on rich empirical evidence and innovative methods, and applying a lifelong learning perspective through the pilot implementation across all education levels (ECEC, primary, secondary, tertiary, VET, adult), the project will offer an effective framework to support the use of arts
in education and to assess their impacts on the development of competences and inclusion of all learners, while also supporting policymakers to inform and improve their policies and systems.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2024-DATA-01-01
fields.title: INFORMATION PROCESSING AND COMPLIANCE GRC-SOLUTIONS IN THE ERA OF LMM-COPILOTS
fields.abstract: NECSUS is a platform that integrates the principles of MLOps and GitOps, focusing on automation, collaboration, and end-to-end lifecycle management. It aims to integrate compliance processes, such as regulatory analysis, data protection laws, and ethical considerations, into system development, deployment, and monitoring. This framework is particularly beneficial in industries where compliance with regulations is critical. NECSUS automates and streamlines compliance processes, reducing human error risk and ensuring consistency, while enhancing cost-effectiveness and reducing time-to-market. It provides policymakers and public sector analytics, projections, and regional statistics on compliance and data for companies while interfacing with Common European Data Spaces, and AI data provisioning organizations. The platform uses an LMM-based Bidirectional compliance by design architecture, offering an end-to-end automated and streamlined compliance system. The proposed platform supports context-aware legal, ethical, and environmental-compliant AI models, resilient to AI cyberattacks that can analyse and evaluate the respective compliance of an organisation, service, asset and so on. It addresses AI and LLM/LMM bias issues by supporting standardized AI solutions to define, quantify, measure, and mitigate data bias and fairness. The platform ensures trustworthiness, explainability, data traceability, consent management, and interoperability through smart contracting and standardized sharing. NECSUS is a privacy and confidentiality-enabled platform with an advanced federated and distributed architecture, organized by an LLM/LMM Orchestrator for knowledge-distilled datasets and AI training pipelines, reducing data traffic and energy consumption.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2024-DIGITAL-EMERGING-01-22
fields.title: PrometheusQCode
fields.abstract:
In the mythological narrative of Prometheus, the Titan defied the gods to deliver fire to humanity, symbolizing knowledge and progress. Inspired by this tale, PrometheusQCode emerges, envisioning a technological parallel. It seeks to revolutionize software programming by bestowing Quantum Programmability, Security, and Assistance upon mankind. Much like Prometheus challenging divine order, PrometheusQCode unlocks quantum computing's potential, guiding us to computational realms unseen.
In today's digital age, software complexity burgeons, presenting challenges in quality assurance and security. Reports by Whatfix and SignMyCode highlight these concerns, echoed by GitLab's emphasis on securing the software supply chain. Agile practices strive for secure code, yet feedback remains lacking. PrometheusQCode aims to address these gaps.
The consortium pledges to develop tools to detect and eliminate threats throughout the software development life cycle. It promises automation, Quantum-focused assistance, and code analysis, aiding developers from requirements to operation. Its suite aims to facilitate Trusted Security and Privacy Software Development Lifecycle, implement Design by Contract (DbC) for robust software, provide automated requirement derivation, assist in selecting secure digital services, analyze and repair code vulnerabilities, offer real-time recommendations for vulnerability resolution, enable High-level Quantum Programming, provide Quantum Programming training and assistance, and enhance tool performance through HITL and RPA technologies.

PrometheusQCode stands as a beacon, guiding the path towards a future where quantum programmability enhances software development, ensuring security, reliability, and progress.

fields.thematic_areas: HORIZON-CL4-2024-DIGITAL-EMERGING-01-03
fields.title: foundaTion mOdels for Robots that haNdle small, soft and Deformable Objects
fields.department_role: Coordinator, AI, computer vision, machine learning
fields.abstract: TORNADO will be a ground-breaking cloud robotics system, facilitated by low-latency wireless communications. It is envisioned as installed within a dynamic, time-varying environment where humans are present and pursue their own goals. The TORNADO robot will be deployed at the command of a local human supervisor, in order to execute a sequence of non-repetitive tasks that are being autonomously and adaptively identified based on very high-level human instructions (e.g., verbal). Successful execution of this task plan requires the multifunctional TORNADO robot to be able to generalize well and to dynamically adapt to the current situation and to novel desired functionalities, with regard to its navigation, planning, HRI and manipulation capabilities.

fields.thematic_areas:
Ψηφιακές Τεχνολογίες  
08.01 Τεχνολογίες διαχείρισης δεδομένων και πληροφοριών

fields.department_role: Διεξαγωγή βασικής έρευνας για 2 από τους 4 πυλώνες του έργου (εξαγωγή γνώσης από πολυτροπικό περιεχόμενο, ανάπτυξη προγνωστικών μοντέλων επιρροής στα κοινωνικά δίκτυα).
fields.department_staff: Βαρλάμης, Μιχαήλ, Δίου, Σαρδιανός, Χρόνης, Δαβαλάς, Καφατάρη
fields.abstract:
Ένα σημαντικό πρόβλημα που αντιμετωπίζει σήμερα ένας ο διαχειριστής μιας διαφημιστικής εκστρατείας είναι η αποτελεσματική διαχείριση του διαθέσιμου προϋπολογισμού για τη βέλτιστη επίτευξη των στόχων που έχουν τεθεί. Η πληθώρα των μετρικών αξιολόγησης μιας καμπάνιας επιχειρεί να καλύψει τόσο την επιρροή της καμπάνιας στη διαμόρφωση της κοινής γνώμης, όσο και τις επιδόσεις σε επίπεδο προσέλκυσης πελατών, δημιουργίας εσόδων κλπ. Για το σκοπό αυτό χρησιμοποιεί πολλά και διαφορετικά εργαλεία και πλατφόρμες, αλλά και αρκετή εμπειρική γνώση η οποία δεν βασίζεται στα δεδομένα αλλά στην αποσπασματική εικόνα που μπορεί να έχει ο διαχειριστής. Η επιστημονική κοινότητα αντιμετωπίζει αυτή την πρόκληση ως ένα πρόβλημα βελτιστοποίησης και δυναμικής τοποθέτησης της επένδυσης σε πολλαπλά κανάλια ή τεχνικές προώθησης (Luzon et al, 2022).
Καθώς ολοένα και περισσότερα δεδομένα είναι πλέον διαθέσιμα στα χέρια των διαχειριστών, είναι πλέον σαφές ότι η αποτελεσματική ανάλυση των δεδομένων αυτών μπορεί να οδηγήσουν σε πιο έξυπνες επενδυτικές αποφάσεις και ταυτόχρονα να στηρίξουν την πιο αποτελεσματική βελτιστοποίηση της διαφημιστικής επένδυσης (Buhalis & Volchek, 2021). Η βασική πρόκληση λοιπόν δημιουργεί επιμέρους προκλήσεις που σχετίζονται α) με τη συνένωση ετερογενών δεδομένων διαφορετικής φύσης και δομής που συγκεντρώνεται από διάφορα κανάλια, β) με την ανάλυση του τεράστιου όγκου δεδομένων και την ανίχνευση προτύπων, γ) με την πρόβλεψη των τάσεων που δημιουργούνται στο αγοραστικό κοινό και την αξιοποίησή τους.
Το παρόν έργο στοχεύει να αντιμετωπίσει τις 4 προκλήσεις που προαναφέρθηκαν, και αποτυπώνονται στην Εικόνα 1, αξιοποιώντας την επιστημονική κατάρτιση των ερευνητικών φορέων και παράγοντας λύσεις αιχμής που ξεπερνούν την τεχνολογική στάθμη σε κάθε πεδίο. Ταυτόχρονα επιχειρεί να δοκιμάσει τις λύσεις που θα αναπτυχθούν σε ένα πραγματικό επιχειρηματικό περιβάλλον το οποίο προσφέρει η PaloWise στους πελάτες της. Πελάτες της αποτελούν ελληνικές και πολυεθνικές εταιρείες που δραστηριοποιούνται στην Ελλάδα στους κλάδους των χρηματοοικονομικών υπηρεσιών (π.χ. τράπεζες, ασφαλιστικές  κτλ), τηλεπικοινωνιών, καταναλωτικών προϊόντων (FMCG), λιανικού εμπορίου, ενέργειας, φαρμακευτικών και  αυτοκινητοβιομηχανίας για τις οποίες η εταιρία συλλέγει δεδομένα από το web και τα social media, αλλά και από εξειδικευμένες πλατφόρμες που καταγράφουν τις επιδόσεις μιας διαφημιστικής καμπάνιας (Return on Investment, Customer Acquisition Cost, Conversion Rate, Customer Lifetime Value, κλπ).

fields.title: A Ground-breAking collaboratioN framework realizing the next era of cybercrime Detection And muLtistakeholder investigation For LEAs, judicial ecosystems, and citizens
fields.department_staff:
Επ. Καθ. Γεώργιος Θ. Παπαδόπουλος
Επ. Καθ. Βασίλειος Ευθυμίου
fields.abstract: GANDALF will set new grounds to the fight against advanced forms of cyber threats and cyber-dependent crimes; it will (i) realise cutting-edge agency-to-agency data sharing mechanisms, optimising the balance between transparency and privacy based on the needs of each LEA; (ii) deploy a modular, decision-support toolbox that will comprise not only ground-breaking technologies for collaborative investigation, prediction and identification of advanced forms of cyber threats, but also optimisation mechanisms enabling the full exploitation of these technologies; (iii) build on the above 2 offerings and deliver a customizable, collaborative crime investigation sandbox for scenarios, hypotheses analysis and crime investigation; and (iv) facilitate policy drafting, training and citizens’ engagement via innovative mechanisms that will realise the Cyber Hygiene 2.0 vision.

fields.abstract: CERBERUS aims to exploit swarm learning mechanisms and introduce a Human-Swarm AI Teaming Crime Investigation Modular toolbox capable to accelerate the collection, analysis and presentation of critical information and the recommendation of actions to investigators, in order to facilitate, accelerate and better inform their crime investigation process. CERBERUS will design an advanced, configurable, re-adaptable, iterative, incremental, and context-independent investigative activities decision support toolbox, for enhancing and augmenting the intelligence of the professionals, and aid them to move towards more effective and efficient crime investigation.

fields.thematic_areas: Sustainability, circular economy, e-waste, recycling, repairing, re-using
fields.title: European ECOsystem for greeN Electronics
fields.abstract:
This project has the main goal to reduce E-waste in Europe in working on already existing E-waste, developing new tooling to extend
lifetime and recyclability of E-waste, deploy at European level the new best practices and more important to develop a strong
European ecosystem in this domain.

+46 partners

fields.thematic_areas: energy efficiency, intelligent transport systems
fields.title: Trusted lifetime in operation for a circular economy
fields.abstract:
Climate change, CO2 footprint, energy transition, safety & security as well as sovereignty are key issues that the common population
can very well relate to today. As we face critical challenges, research and development in our ECS domain needs to address them
more than ever.
In particular the energy transition needs to be accelerated in order to become more independent from gas and oil energy, which was
considered being available at low costs and without limits until recently. This assumption has been proven to be based on very fragile
grounds and it has come to an end. One solution to accelerate the energy transition is to use all generated energy. This means that
overflow energy produced in wind or solar parks needs to be available in periods when common energy generation is lacking. This
requires important investments into infrastructure, which will only flow, if investors trust into the technologies enabling solutions.
The faster the trust is built, the faster the transition can be realized.
On the other hand, technologies and products that will ensure an economic use of resources and enable long and trusted lifetime of
systems and components in the ECS domain have to be developed. ARCHIMEDES contributes to this in the domains of automotive,
aviation and industry. In ARCHIMEDES, components, models and methodologies to increase the efficiency and lifetime of the
propulsion components, power components and energy storage devices in automotive, aviation and industry will be developed. This
will support the energy transition on the consumer`s side.
In order to support this mission, ARCHIMEDES aims to change technologies and products in the automotive, aviation, infrastructure
	domains and the related ecosystem towards a resilient, de-carbonized, digitalized, and green EU: It will help building trust in the new	technologies and thus contribute to accelerating the energy transition, safety and security.
fields.partners:
AVL Austria
HUA
+48 partners

fields.thematic_areas: automotive electronics
fields.title: Ensuring European ECS Value Chain Sovereignty through Shaping the Future of ECS for Automotive  Applications
fields.abstract:
ShapeFuture will drive innovation in fundamental Electronic Components and Systems (ECS) that are essential 
for robust, powerful, fail-operational and integrated perception, cognition, AI-enabled decision making, resilient 
automation and computing, as well as communications, for highly automated vehicles.
Its overarching vision is to bring ECS Innovation at the Heart of Europe's Mobility Transformation, 
thereby elevating Sovereignty by Perfecting Programmable ECS Solutions for Intelligent, Safe, 
Connected, and Highly Automated Vehicles.
The project will result in the following main tangible outcomes:
• Safety, security and reliability of in-vehicle systems to levels appropriate for mass-market deployment.
• Availability and supply of leading-edge ECS for the European automotive supply chain and for OEMs to 
be at the forefront of technology developments in the 2030s.
• Increased Accuracy and Robustness of ECS for perception with smaller form factors and lower power 
consumption.
• ECS attributed with cognition features and improved human-Machine Interface (HMI).
• ECS with cognitive processing and decision-making capabilities.
• ECS for resilient automation and communications.
• Increased technology acceptance that will also lead to business sovereignty safeguard.
15 demonstrators and 2 impact studies will showcase the project’s achievements and their capability to deliver 
innovations and secure future application advances in core markets for European society – Mobility, Green Deal, 
Digital Society, Safety and Industry.
The project innovations will leverage the expertise of world-renowned industrial (5 OEMs, 24 Tier-1, Tier-2 
and technology providers) and 12 research partners along the complete automotive and semiconductor value 
chains, providing Europe with a competitive edge in a growing market. 
Importantly, ShapeFuture will contribute to ensuring European ECS Sovereignty by shaping the future 
of ECS in mobility.

fields.title_en: Graph Algorithms in JGraphT
fields.abstract:
Στην εργασία αυτή ο φοιτητής θα υλοποιήσει και θα πειραματιστεί με κάποιον γνωστό αλγόριθμο γραφημάτων π.χ εύρεσης κοινοτήτων, εύρεση συντομότερων μονοπατιών, κ.τ.λ. Η βιβλιοθήκη JGraphT είναι η πιο αναπτυγμένη Java βιβλιοθήκη
γραφημάτων και παρέχει ένα εύρος αλγορίθμων και τεχνικών. Στα πλαίσια της πτυχιακής ο φοιτητής θα υλοποιήσει κάποιον γνωστό αλγόριθμο στα πρότυπα ποιότητας μία αναγνωρισμένης open-source βιβλιοθήκης και θα πραγματοποιήσει πειράματα
χρησιμοποιώντας πραγματικά δεδομένα. 

Απαραίτητες Γνώσεις: προγραμματισμός Java, βασικές έννοιες  γραφημάτων

fields.title_gr: Υλοποίηση παράλληλου BFS στην JGraphT
fields.title_en: Implementing Parallel BFS in JGraphT
fields.abstract:
Στην εργασία αυτή ο φοιτητής θα υλοποιήσει μια παράλληλη έκδοση του BFS για multi-core μηχανήματα στην JGraphT. O αλγόριθμος BFS μπορεί με προσεκτική υλοποίηση να τρέξει παράλληλα και να οδηγήσει σε σημαντική μείωση του χρόνου
εκτέλεσης σε σύγχρονα μηχανήματα. Στα πλαίσια της πτυχιακής ο φοιτητής θα αναπτύξει κώδικα στα πρότυπα της open-source βιβλιοθήκης JGraphT και θα πραγματοποιήσει πειράματα σε μεγάλου μεγέθους γραφήματα από τον πραγματικό κόσμο.

fields.title_gr: Σχεδιασμός και ανάπτυξη νέων μεθόδων (γνωσιακών) για διάχυση επιστημονικής πληροφορίας
fields.title_en: Design and development of cognitive methods for dissemination and communication
fields.abstract: Σχεδιασμός και ανάπτυξη συστήματος και δημιουργία εφαρμογής (web based) για εύρεση και ταξινόμηση συνεδρίων και περιοδικών για δημοσιεύσεις ερευνητικού έργου

fields.title_gr: Μοντελοποίηση Απόδοσης Εκτέλεσης σε περιβάλλοντα Function as a Service
fields.title_en: Performance Modelling of serverless executions
fields.abstract:
Τα περιβάλλοντα serverless computing και ειδικά η παραλλαγή του Function as a Service δίνει συγκριτικά πλεονεκτήματα ως προς την εκτέλεση εφαρμογών. Παρόλαυτα παρουσιάζει και κάποια εγγενή μειονεκτήματα που αφορούν την εκτέλεση των εφαρμογών on demand (cold start latencies, state in functions κλπ).
